definition: free from error, to treat a defect
details:
adjective
- free from error
= synonyms: right
- correct in opinion or judgment
= synonyms: right
- socially right or correct
= synonyms: right
- in accord with accepted standards of usage or procedure
= synonyms: right
verb
- to treat a defect
= example: to treat a defect
- to make right or correct
= synonyms: right
- to alter or regulate so as to achieve accuracy or conform to a standard
= synonyms: set, adjust
- to censure severely
= synonyms: chasten, chastise, castigate, objurgate
- to go down in value
= example: to go down in value
= synonyms: drop
- to make reparations or amends for
= synonyms: redress
- to punish in order to gain control or enforce obedience
= synonyms: discipline
- to adjust for
= example: to adjust for
= synonyms: counterbalance, make up, even out, even up, compensate, even off
